TopicTitle: Top Gun AI - The Official Tournament Thread

Articles.Content:
> 
> 
> 21 hours ago, NotAnAimbot said:
> 
> 
> So I guess it's a bit late to submit?
> 

Wait for the next tournament to roll around.  Should be mid-March or early April, depending.  Unless someone else decides to run a tournament, that is. 

> 
> 
> 20 hours ago, colmo said:
> 
> 
> BDA has had a competition mode since the 18th Feb. Why isn't it being used?
> 

The tournament was started before competition mode was released, and updating it mid-tournament would be unfair to everyone involved.  I would hazard a guess that all **future** tournaments will use competition mode.  I can tell you that mine certainly will. 

> 
> 
> 20 hours ago, Combatsmithen said:
> 
> 
> [@CreativeCombat](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/112338-creativecombat/) Since the competitions are starting I want to know if my raptor I submitted is in the challenge.
> 

It is.

F-2 vs. F-3 :

I've runned the simulation some more times, the F-2 is better than the F-3.

...And be sure you have the latest version of BDA ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif ":cool:")

Each plane has it's own minimum stall speed depending on its design. [This monster I built, for example,](http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/498016551066825846/1FBA6C3B2FEEF0729AA52EA11DFE1141EC0E69C3/) can maintain control (but not lift) as slow as 25 m/s, probably due to a combination of huge wing and elevon area.

**Edited <time datetime="2016-03-04T01:08:10Z" title="03/04/2016 01:08  AM" data-short="8 yr">March 4, 2016</time> by Triop**

> 
> 
> 30 minutes ago, drtricky said:
> 
> 
> Each plane has it's own minimum stall speed depending on its design. [This monster I built, for example,](http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/498016551066825846/1FBA6C3B2FEEF0729AA52EA11DFE1141EC0E69C3/) can maintain control (but not lift) as slow as 25 m/s, probably due to a combination of huge wing and elevon area.
> 

Well, the design is supposed to be based on the Su-33/MiG-29K, with stall speeds around 66-68 m/s. I think it's pretty decent compared to that. I'll try to make it more maneuverable in low speed tho.

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, Triop said:
> 
> 
> I've runned the simulation some more times, the F-2 is better than the F-3.
> 

Strange. I've done manual flight testing, and the F-3 is much more maneuverable than the F-2, to the point it could slightly out turn the K-18. It's also lighter by about 4-5 tons. What did you observe in the F-2 that gave it an edge?

> 
> 
> 2 minutes ago, NotAnAimbot said:
> 
> 
> Strange. I've done manual flight testing, and the F-3 is much more maneuverable than the F-2, to the point it could slightly out turn the K-18. It's also lighter by about 4-5 tons. What did you observe in the F-2 that gave it an edge?
> 

I only did BDA simulations, having both settings equalized as default, with exception of firing interval setting to 1.

Your F-2 does better here.

How is my F-17 holding up there ? ![:lol:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_laugh.png ":lol:") is it any good ?
